text:
üáßüáæ**Chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, Major General Pavel Muraveiko**:
__
____üü¢____¬´Today we have actually entered the final phase of preparations for the main event of the current year ‚Äì the joint strategic exercise of the armed forces of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation, "Zapad-2025". The final reconnaissance has been completed, during which we agreed on the deployment areas for troops, command posts, as well as identified the areas and training grounds  where the main phases of the exercise will take place.

Given the complex military and political situation, and the constant accusations against the Republic of Belarus of having aggressive intentions, we made the decision to move the exercise zones away from our borders. This was done to eliminate any kind of speculation and to avoid provoking anyone with the actions of our troops. However, I would like to emphasize that this step should not be interpreted as weakness, appeasement, or a response to someone‚Äôs claims. It is simply one of the steps taken to stabilise the situation and reassure the international community. 

However, today our Western colleagues have begun to speculate on this process.

Poland has already announced that it is ready to conduct division-scale exercises near our borders in the Grodno region, in Belovezhskaya Pushcha.  Lithuania is moving its "Iron Wolf" brigade to the Pabrade training ground and is planning activities just 15 kilometers from our border.  Under these circumstances, we reserve the right to relocate some of our units during the exercises to work out exclusively defensive scenarios, including in the areas I have indicated.

The second feature of the exercises is that we have deliberately removed offensive scenarios and concepts from the scenario and plan. 

The exercise consists exclusively of defensive episodes, aimed at protecting and ensuring the security of the Union State.

The third feature is that we have reduced the number of troops involved in the exercise. We previously stated that it would be large in scale. Currently, we have reduced the number of troops participating in the exercise by half.

The fourth distinctive element is our intention to use the latest developments in modern military art during the exercise - including the active use of unmanned aerial vehicles, electronic warfare means, various robotic and automated systems,  modern air defence techniques, combating drones, and many other various features that we plan to practise with our armed forces.

Additionally, as a gesture of goodwill and transparency, we plan to invite observers from various countries to attend the exercise in order to demonstrate and confirm our commitment to confidence and security building measures.

We are considering inviting member states of the Collective Security Treaty Organisation, the Commonwealth of Independent States, the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, and countries of the far arc. In addition, we plan to invite accredited military attach√©s, as well as OSCE participating States within the framework of the Vienna Document, to which we remain committed and on which we continue to work¬ª.__
